result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnold W Tepiew Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

May apply for early discharge after 12 months, if agent recommends.  

Cooperate with any Domestic Violence counseling, Domestic Violence Court, if agent deems it appropriate.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold W Tepiew Jr.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections.  State recommended:  4-6 months jail.  Credit for 96 days.  Defense recommends: time served.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution. Victim present in the courtroom.  No comment from the victim.    Court ordered:  Time served.   Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  Credit for 96 days.

records.addlTxt: DV court.  Petition for discharge reviewed by the court.  Discharged from DV Court.

DV court.  Has a daycare plan.  Discussion regarding his roofing job.  He still works for Arby's too.  Still sees D.G. once a month.  He was at the Casino twice.  He is not supposed to be where alcohol is sold or served.  He will not go to the Casino anymore.  He is finished with B.G.'s class.  He may skip 9/12 DV court hearing.

DV Court - Discussed childcare issues and employment.  He is to get a plan prepared and present it next time on how to proceed with childcare issues.  Working on final project.  His written plan is to go to T.M. by end of next week.
DV court.  Getting close to being done.  He has his final project from B.G.  Request discharge papers from agent.  Discussion regarding child visitation issues.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  No show for B.G. on 7/5.  Vehicle broke down.  Missed probation appointment.  6 day sanction.

DV Court - Discussed work and new apartment.  He is to call T.M. regarding him going out of town over the 4th.  Judge will message her as well.  He states things are going pretty well.  Will be working on final project soon.
DV court.  Discussion regarding work.  Doing well in B.G.'s class.  Things going good overall.
DV court.  Things going good.  Getting close to getting done with B.G's class.  Talk to agent about UA's.

DV court.  He got hired full time at a roofing company.  He will still work at Arby's on weekends.  He may have an issue paying for B.G.'s class tomorrow.  Call him today and let him know.  He will need to talk to his new employer about keeping his appointments.  Also needs to talk to his agent about the new job.
DV Court - He's working more hours on a regular schedule.  He is to let his agent know regarding his hours.  Doing a great job overall.
DV court.  Job hours cut.  Only working 2 days this week.
Working full-time at Arby's.  Going well.  Discussion regarding testing condition.  To drop off receipts by 4:00 on Fridays.

DV court.  Things going good.  Work going good.  Lots of hours.  Test at the kiosk at the Jackson County Sheriff's Dept. 3 times per week.  Random call in.  Slips from the kiosk to be given to Agent T.M. by Friday at 3:30 pm.
DV court.  Work hectic.  Going good.  Class with B.G. going good.
DV court.  Has a meeting with B.G. on Thursday.  He is working at Arby's, opening today.  28 hours this week.  He has an appointment for AODA on 2/13.
DV court.  Court explained the DV court process to the defendant.  Compliance court.  He understood.  Hung up on B.G.  Don't do that again.
2nd amended

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Amended information filed with the court.  Amended to add repeater allegation. Another amended information will be filed, as the domestic allegation was left out.  Defendant plead guilty to the amended charge.  Victim never responded to the DA's office.  No restitution requested.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Court confirmed the repeater allegation with the defendant and Attorney Linehan.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Misdemeanor Domestic Disorderly Conduct as a repeater, contrary to,  947.01(1),  968.075(1)(a), and 939.62(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for 18 months probation.  DNA sample and surhcarnge.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Cooperat with DV counsetling.  o/m employment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Attorney Linehan.  Requesting a no contact not be imposed.  May apply for early discharge from probation after 12 months.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, 18 months probation.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Cooperate with DV counseling or DV court if agent recommends.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  CC    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  May apply for early discharge from probation after 12 months, if agent recommends.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed.
